forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 4pm. Partly sunny. High near 56, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. West wind around 15 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the morning unfolds in Downtown San Francisco, the city is cloaked in a gentle gray veil, promising rain that will sweep through the streets before the hour hand strikes four. Light winds from the west rustle the leaves, while the forecast hints at a transition from a drizzly start to a partly sunny afternoon. Hints of brightness may manage to peek through the clouds, but the temperature lingers near a cool 54 degrees—just shy of chilly. The ambiance carries the tantalizing scent of rain mingling with the faint aroma of damp earth, a reminder of nature’s embrace. 

For those venturing out, a layered approach to attire may be wise; perhaps a light sweater beneath a waterproof jacket, to navigate both the remaining moisture in the air and the refreshing kiss of the west wind. With the chance of precipitation at a staggering 90%, one might find solace indoors at a quaint café, indulging in a warm beverage while the world outside dances between mist and sun. The allure of the day lies not only in the weather but in the simple joys of watching droplets race down a windowpane, contemplating the city’s iconic silhouette emerging from a shroud of fog. An afternoon spent strolling along the waterfront promises both a brisk breath of fresh air and the comfort of an escape from routine, even as the clouds linger in playful defiance.
